Package io.ib67.astralflow.scheduler

Class TickReceipt<T extends Tickable<T>>

java.lang.Object
io.ib67.astralflow.scheduler.TickReceipt<T>
Type Parameters:
T - Tick Target
@AvailableSince("0.1.0") public final class TickReceipt<T extends Tickable<T>> extends Object
A Receipt that used to control pre-tick behaviours. Also see Scheduler.add(Tickable)

    • alsoTicks

      public TickReceipt<T> alsoTicks(Tickable<T> tickable)
      Runs a new tickable when the original tickable is called. Contrary to alwaysTicks(Tickable) ，It is depending on conditions coming from requires(Predicate)
      Parameters:
      tickable -
      Returns:
      the new tickable's receipt.

    • alwaysTicks

      public TickReceipt<T> alwaysTicks(Tickable<T> tickable)
      Calls a new tickable when the original tickable is called, even though the conditions are not passed.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the new tickable's receipt

    • syncWith

      public TickReceipt<T> syncWith(Tickable<T> tickable)
      Like alsoTicks(Tickable), but this method doesn't returns a new receipt, only returning itself. Restricted by conditions that comes from requires(Predicate)
      Parameters:
      tickable -
      Returns:
      itself

    • drop

      public void drop()
      Mark this receipt is dropped and won't be called. GC will clear this if there is no strong references left. Also see isDropped()
